text: The 2019–20 Brucellosis outbreak is a zoonotic infectious type of disease that is transmitted to domestic animals. It is a type of flu that spread in northwestern China to about 6,000 infected. It was first recorded on September 12, 2019 in Lanzhou, China. More than 6,000 cases were confirmed. 55,725 tested positive. Category:2019 in China Category:2021 disasters in Asia Category:21st-century epidemics Category:September 2019 events Category:September 2021 events
title: 2019–20 Brucellosis outbreak
